column1: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, Wargame
Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

Quebec 1759 is a small, simple and short block board-wargame covering the conflict between the British and the French in Canada during the French and Indian War. The game comes with a gorgeous map drawn in the style of the period. Movement is conducted via a point-to-point system following the roads and towns in the area around Quebec. The game comes with handfuls of blocks to represent the British and French units.<br/><br/>This title uses Columbia Games Block system. While there are variations...

Cities: Quebec (Canada), Components: Block Wargames, Country: Canada, Country: France, Country: Great Britain, History: French and Indian War, Players: Two-Player Only Games, Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players, Region: Quebec (Canada)
